medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 2 a.m. with vomiting associated with irritability and frequent crying. Over the next 7 hours, there were four episodes of nonbilious, nonbloody vomiting and episodes of unresponsiveness, which lasted from 2 to 3 seconds up to 30 to 60 seconds, with increasing difficulty to arouse the patient after the fourth or fifth episode.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Gastroesophageal reflux disease diagnosed at age 3.4 months, which resolved after treatment with lansoprazole for 3 months; developmental delays addressed with early intervention specialists.
medical_history.family_history: Mother has a history of migraines associated with intermittent blackouts; no family history of gastrointestinal illnesses.
medical_history.social_history: Lived with mother and stayed overnight with father intermittently; attended day care. Parents are from South America and had recently separated.
